Finding the best solution among alternatives.

## What is Optimization?

Maximizing or minimizing an objective while satisfying constraints.

## Common Applications

- Resource allocation
- Scheduling
- Supply chain
- Pricing
- Portfolio optimization

## Components

| Component | Example |
|-----------|--------|
| Objective | Maximize profit |
| Decision variables | Units to produce |
| Constraints | Budget, capacity |

> ğŸ’¡ Optimization finds the BEST decision, not just a good one!

slides.title: Types of Optimization
slides.content:
# Types of Optimization ğŸ”§

## Linear Programming (LP)
- Linear objective and constraints
- Optimal solution guaranteed

## Integer Programming (IP)
- Variables must be integers
- Harder to solve

## Mixed Integer (MIP)
- Some integer, some continuous
- Very common in practice

## Non-Linear (NLP)
- Curved relationships
- Local vs global optimum

## Choosing Method

| Problem Type | Method |
|--------------|--------|
| Continuous, linear | LP |
| Yes/no decisions | IP |
| Complex routing | MIP |
| Curved relationships | NLP |
